The shares of the top 1 per cent of the population have grown especially fast.
Very few studies, especially large-scale ones, have been conducted on the topic of the safety of female journalists.
lemma_branch.definition_local: больше, чем другие вещи или люди, или гораздо больше, чем обычно

lemma_branch.definition: for one particular person, purpose, or reason
examples: I cooked this meal especially for you.
lemma_branch.definition_local: для одного конкретного человека, цели или причины

lemma_branch.definition: a unit of money used in European countries that belong to the European Union; €
examples: This greater liquidity, however, was not reflected in increased credit to the private sector, which has been slowing in much of the world, and even declining in year-on-year terms in the United States and the euro area.

The data provided in balance sheets for the euro area and in these preliminary compilations allow a more comprehensive picture of household assets - including household contingent pension assets - and liabilities, to be drawn.
There are differing reasons for the limited scope in providing further significant stimulus in the United States and the euro zone, although the implications are similar.
Consensus expectations for 2012 growth in the euro zone turned negative.
lemma_branch.definition_local: денежная единица, используемая в европейских странах, входящих в Европейский Союз; €

lemma_branch.definition: relating to Europe
examples: Europop (= pop music from Europe)
The good health of the euro is vital to the world economy.
New Caledonia's anti-independence parties as well as the Territory's business sector are supporting the introduction of the euro.
An appropriation of 200,000 euro is granted yearly for the development of vocational education for immigrants.
lemma_branch.definition_local: отношение к Европе

lemma_branch.definition: flat, level, or smooth
examples: Find an even surface to work on.
lemma_branch.definition_local: плоский, ровный или гладкий

lemma_branch.definition: An even temperature or rate is regular and does not change very much.
lemma_branch.definition_local: Даже температура или скорость является регулярной и не очень сильно меняется.

lemma_branch.definition: An even number is a number that can be exactly divided by two, for example four, six, or eight.
lemma_branch.definition_local: Четное число-это число, которое может быть точно разделено на два, например четыре, шесть или восемь.

lemma_branch.definition: not now owing someone money
examples: If you pay for my cinema ticket, we'll be even.
lemma_branch.definition_local: не сейчас должен кому-то деньги

lemma_branch.definition: An even race or competition is one that both players, teams, or people involved have an equal chance of winning.
lemma_branch.definition_local: Четная гонка или соревнование-это та, в которой оба игрока, команды или люди, участвующие в ней, имеют равные шансы на победу.

lemma_branch.definition: If you get even with someone who has done something bad to you, you do something bad to them.
lemma_branch.definition_local: Если вы поквитаетесь с кем-то, кто сделал что-то плохое для вас, вы делаете что-то плохое для них.

lemma_branch.definition: used to emphasize something that is surprising
examples: Everyone danced, even Mick.
In addition, there is also the phenomenon of bilingualism or even of multilingualism.
The veto has even been used to prevent the adoption of a programme of work.
Women with disabilities are often exposed to double, or even triple, discrimination.
lemma_branch.definition_local: используется, чтобы подчеркнуть то, что удивительно

lemma_branch.definition: used when comparing things, to emphasize the difference
examples: I think Alex is going to be even taller than his father.
lemma_branch.definition_local: используется при сравнении вещей, чтобы подчеркнуть разницу

lemma_branch.definition: used to emphasize that a particular situation would not change what you have just said
examples: I would never eat meat, even if I was really hungry.
lemma_branch.definition_local: используется, чтобы подчеркнуть, что конкретная ситуация не изменит то, что вы только что сказали

lemma_branch.definition: although
examples: He still smokes, even though he's got asthma.
lemma_branch.definition_local: хотя

lemma_branch.definition: used to emphasize that something surprising is true despite what you have just said
examples: Car prices have gone down a lot, but even so, we couldn't afford to buy one.
lemma_branch.definition_local: используется, чтобы подчеркнуть, что что-то удивительное верно, несмотря на то, что вы только что сказали

lemma_branch.definition: used to politely tell someone bad news or to politely disagree with someone
examples: There are no tickets left, I'm afraid.
I'm afraid that I've broken your vase.
lemma_branch.definition_local: привык вежливо сообщать кому-то плохие новости или вежливо не соглашаться с кем-то

lemma_branch.definition: frightened
examples: She's afraid of water.
lemma_branch.definition_local: испуганный

lemma_branch.definition: worried that something bad might happen
examples: Many people are afraid that they might lose their jobs.
He was afraid of upsetting Clare.
lemma_branch.definition_local: беспокоюсь, что может случиться что-то плохое

lemma_branch.definition: at a later time, after something else has happened
examples: I did my homework and went swimming afterwards.
lemma_branch.definition_local: в более позднее время, после того, как что-то еще произошло

lemma_branch.definition: every person
examples: Everyone agreed with the decision.
lemma_branch.definition_local: каждый человек

lemma_branch.definition: every other person
examples: Everyone else was wearing jeans.
lemma_branch.definition_local: каждый другой человек
